Events that occurred on 27 February.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1917 - J.R.R. Tolkien faces his third Medical Board, and again his leave is extended.
1930 - Joseph Wright, former tutor of Tolkien, dies.
1984 - J.R.R. Tolkien's second son, Michael Tolkien, dies.
2014 - The Fall of Arthur is published in paperback.
2014 - Farmer Giles of Ham pocket edition is published.
2015 - Actor and singer Leonard Nimoy dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3019:
Orc skirmish, Grishnákh leaves. Pippin cuts his rope and drops his brooch.
The Three Hunters reach the East Wall of Rohan (west-cliff of Emyn Muil) at sunrise and find the brooch.
Frodo and Sam sleep at a cliff on the eastern Emyn Muil.
Éomer against Théoden's orders sets out from Eastfold about midnight to pursue the Orcs.
